The horse is one of two extant subspecies of Equus ferus. It is an odd-toed ungulate mammal belonging to the taxonomic family Equidae. The horse has evolved over the past 45 to 55 million years from a small multi-toed creature, Eohippus, into the large, single-toed animal of today. Humans began to domesticate horses around 4000 BC, and their domestication is believed to have been widespread by 3000 BC.
The body condition score (BCS) of a horse is a way to measure the amount of fat on its body. A horse that is underfed will have a low BCS. A horse that is overfed will have a high BCS.
